comment.author: 24036503@N05
comment._content: This photo is gorgeous.  Thank you for providing so many qualitative photos for everyone to see.  Bravo!

comment.author: 7146815@N06
comment._content:
Large negatives (16" by 20"), portable darkroom, sand, heat, etc.... you have to admire these photographers' dedication to recording the world.

It's a long way from taking the 1 hour air conditioned bus tour with your digital point-and-shoot and  "get in, get pictures, get out and we will look at the results at the hotel". There is no sense of truly appreciating the sights of the world as did these pioneers.

comment.author: 42826854@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Heritage Key, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 37178400@N06
comment._content: I visited the relocated temple in February.  Less sense of reverence and soul today.

comment.author: 23115196@N03
comment._content: I have an original oil painting by Frank Dillon.....(a contemporary of Frith's)....with this temple as the subject. I believe this is Trajan's Kiosk....commonly known as "Pharoah's Bed". Here a link to another of Frith's photos of this temple.
